memory: I am Lars Langenbach.
My birthday is the 28th of July, 2004.
I am 20 years old.
I was born in Vienna, Virginia, in Fairfax County.
I currently live in a hacker house in Cambridge.
My cultural and ethnic background is half German, 25% American from Switzerland, and a quarter Japanese.
I speak English and German fluently, and I know a tiny bit of Hindi and Spanish.
I went to the German International School of Washington, DC, for the first 14 years of my life.
I moved to Frankfurt, Germany, where I went to the Humboldt-Gymnasium for about a year.
Then I switched to the Stratdorf International School for the rest of my high school, which was three years.
I am currently studying at the Savannah College of Art and Design, majoring in immersive reality.
I do not have a current job.
My first job was a SCAD intramurals gym assistant, where I scanned people's IDs.
I would love to start my own company someday.
I do not want to become a corporate slave.
I am going to be the next co-president of the Immersive Reality Club at SCAD.
I have been the social media manager for the Immersive Reality Club for the past year.
I used to swim and was a part of my neighborhood's swim team.
I grew up in an atheist family.
I started practicing Hinduism and meditating a year ago.
I dislike arrogant and condescending people.
I often internalize my anger.
I am scared of the dark and shady street corners.
I find dry humor amusing.
I resent it when people assume I'm just a nice person without knowing me well.
I did not vote for Trump; I voted for Kamala Harris.
I have a dream journal that spans over a couple of years.
I fell in love with Anushka, who is my partner and best friend.
I have a close relationship with my brother Wolf, who is four years older than me.
I always felt a strong desire to take care of and treat my siblings well.
I enjoy playing video games with my brother Wolf and have done so since we were kids.
I have a close relationship with my little sister, who is seven years younger than me.
I grew very close to my mother who I view as a superhero for all she has done for me and my family.
I moved to Germany with my family when I was a teenager.
I have a good relationship with my father, who is creative and supportive of my interests.
I have known my best friend Lucas Witzka since kindergarten, and our relationship has remained strong throughout our lives.
I lived with my friend Ulyss throughout high school, and I consider him to be like a twin brother.
I have a close friendship with Tom Spiegel, a friend I met in public school in Germany.
My best friend at SCAD is Ben Hammond, who I met during my time at the college.
I consider myself a procrastinator, which negatively affects my work quality and general health.
I typically prefer to wake up early and try to get eight hours of sleep, but often end up with less due to schoolwork.
I enjoy listening to music daily, especially while working out or during my daily routines.
My main hobbies include drawing, making music, and exploring immersive media.
I grew up loving fantasy and sci-fi genres, starting with Star Wars and Indiana Jones.
I had asthma growing up but I don't have many significant health problems now.
I currently have a pet bearded dragon named Sara Ali Khan.
I had a cat named Itchy who passed away in 2022 and was emotionally supportive throughout my life.
I often go for runs in the morning as part of my routine.
I tend to judge people's character based on first impressions but strive to understand their perspectives.
I am passionate about learning and improving my creative processes.
I believe that AI is a necessary part of the future and should not be boycotted.
I have a defined morning routine that varies depending on my workload and class schedule.
I care about kindness a lot.
I care about my family a lot.
I believe in holding people accountable for their actions.
I have a reactionary side when faced with unkindness.
I try to think logically.
I have been trying to trust my intuition more recently.
I feel out of touch with my emotions.
My favorite book is A Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas.
I really liked Mrs. Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children.
My favorite children's book is Where the Wild Things Are.
I watch a lot of movies.
I really like the movie Trainspotting.
I like the movie Everything, Everywhere, All at Once.
I love Star Wars.
I prefer dramas over romantic comedies.
I like funny movies.
I like Wes Anderson films.
I like Minecraft.
I was into Sea of Thieves for a long time.
I played Rainbow Six Siege a lot with my brother.
I played a lot of Helldivers, which is a sci-fi game.
I was never into console gaming; I mainly played on PC.
I enjoyed classic Nintendo games like Plants vs. Zombies and Bomberman.
I like Breaking Bad and Better Call Saul.
I loved Gravity Falls growing up.
I like mystery and puzzle-solving.
I like classic rock music.
Classic rock is my comfort genre.
My favorite classic rock artists include The Beatles, Queen, and David Bowie.
Child of Vision by Supertramp is one of my favorite songs.
I find the quote from Helplessness Blues by Fleet Foxes relatable.
I enjoy conspiracy theories and find them entertaining.
I find Hindu mythology beautiful and meaningful.
I experience pauses and uncertainty when answering questions.
I try to speak quicker when asked to, but I normally speak slowly.
I like to joke and laugh with people.
I can do impressions and poke fun at little things people say.
